verses.verse: The words <WH1697> of king <WH4428> Lemuel; <WH3927> the oracle <WH4853> which his mother <WH517> taught him. <WH3256>
"Oh, <WH1248> my son! Oh, <WH1248> son of my womb! <WH990> Oh, <WH1248> son of my vows! <WH5088>
Don't <WH5414> give your strength <WH2428> to women, <WH802> nor your ways <WH1870> to that which destroys <WH4229> kings. <WH4428>
It is not for kings, <WH4428> Lemuel; <WH3927> it is not for kings <WH4428> to drink <WH8354> wine; <WH3196> nor for <WH335> princes <WH7336> to say, <WH7941> 'Where is strong drink?'
lest they drink, <WH8354> and forget <WH7911> the law, <WH2710> and pervert <WH8138> the justice <WH1779> due to anyone who is afflicted. <WH1121>
Give <WH5414> strong drink <WH7941> to him who is ready to perish; <WH6> and wine <WH3196> to the bitter <WH4751> in soul: <WH5315>
Let him drink, <WH8354> and forget <WH7911> his poverty, <WH7389> and remember <WH2142> his misery no more. <WH5999>
Open <WH6605> your mouth <WH6310> for the mute, <WH483> in the cause <WH1779> of all who are left <WH1121> desolate. <WH2475>
Open <WH6605> your mouth, <WH6310> judge <WH8199> righteously, <WH6664> and serve <WH1777> justice to the poor <WH6041> and needy. <WH34>"
Who can find <WH4672> a worthy <WH2428> woman? <WH802> For her price <WH4377> is far <WH7350> above rubies. <WH6443>
The heart <WH3820> of her husband <WH1167> trusts <WH982> in her. <WH2637> He shall have no lack of gain. <WH7998>
She does <WH1580> him good, <WH2896> and not harm, <WH7451> all the days <WH3117> of her life. <WH2416>
She seeks <WH1875> wool <WH6785> and flax, <WH6593> and works <WH6213> eagerly <WH2656> with her hands. <WH3709>
She is like the merchant <WH5503> ships. <WH591> She brings <WH935> her bread <WH3899> from afar. <WH4801>
She rises <WH6965> also while it is yet night, <WH3915> gives <WH5414> food <WH2964> to her household, <WH1004> and portions <WH2706> for her servant girls. <WH5291>
She considers <WH2161> a field, <WH7704> and buys <WH3947> it. <WH6529> With the fruit of her hands, <WH3709> she plants <WH5193> a vineyard. <WH3754>
She arms <WH2296> her waist <WH4975> with strength, <WH5797> and makes her arms <WH2220> strong. <WH5797>
She perceives <WH2938> that her merchandise <WH5504> is profitable. <WH2896> Her lamp <WH5216> doesn't <WH3518> go out by night. <WH3915>
She lays <WH7971> her hands <WH3027> to the distaff, <WH6418> and her hands <WH3709> hold <WH8551> the spindle. <WH3601>
She opens <WH6566> her arms <WH3709> to the poor; <WH6041> yes, <WH7971> she extends her hands <WH3027> to the needy. <WH34>
She is not afraid <WH3372> of the snow <WH7950> for her household; <WH1004> for all her household <WH1004> are clothed <WH3847> with scarlet. <WH8144>
She makes <WH6213> for herself carpets of tapestry. <WH4765> Her clothing <WH3830> is fine linen <WH8336> and purple. <WH713>
Her husband <WH1167> is respected <WH3045> in the gates, <WH8179> when he sits <WH3427> among the elders <WH2205> of the land. <WH776>
She makes <WH6213> linen <WH5466> garments and sells <WH4376> them, <WH5414> and delivers sashes <WH2289> to the merchant. <WH3669>
Strength <WH5797> and dignity <WH1926> are her clothing. <WH3830> She laughs <WH7832> at the time <WH3117> to come. <WH314>
She opens <WH6605> her mouth <WH6310> with wisdom. <WH2451> Faithful <WH2617> instruction <WH8451> is on her tongue. <WH3956>
She looks well <WH6822> to the ways <WH1979> of her household, <WH1004> and doesn't <WH398> eat the bread <WH3899> of idleness. <WH6104>
Her children <WH1121> rise up <WH6965> and call her blessed. <WH833> Her husband <WH1167> also praises her: <WH1984>
"Many <WH7227> women <WH1323> do <WH6213> noble <WH2428> things, <WH5927> but you excel them all."
Charm <WH2580> is deceitful, <WH8267> and beauty <WH3308> is vain; <WH1892> but a woman <WH802> who fears <WH3373> Yahweh, <WH3068> she shall be praised. <WH1984>
Give <WH5414> her of the fruit <WH6529> of her hands! <WH3027> Let her works <WH4639> praise <WH1984> her in the gates! <WH8179>
